snippet: The court said Thursday that it had delayed a decision on the validity of a referendum to impeach President Traian Basesc until Sept. 12, plunging the country into further political turmoil and uncertainty.
abstract: Romania's Constitutional Court says it has delayed decision on validity of referendum to impeach Pres Traian Basesc, even though the overwhelming majority of ballots were cast in favor of ousting him; cites contradictory data over number of eligible voters.

byline.contributor: George Calin contributed reporting from Bucharest.

lead_paragraph: The court said Thursday that it had delayed a decision on the validity of a referendum to impeach President Traian Basesc until Sept. 12, plunging the country into further political turmoil and uncertainty.

headline.seo: Romanian Court Says It Can’t Certify Results in Ouster Vote
headline.main: Court Decides Not to Certify Ouster Vote in Romania
headline.print_headline: Court Decides Not to Certify Ouster Vote In Romania
